intro: Urophyllum acuminatissimum, commonly known as the slender-flowered urophyllum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
